results.title: Methods analysis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Methods analysis is used to reduce production costs by increasing the productivity of men and machines. The film demonstrates the basic approach and techniques of the methods analyst in studying the manufacturing cycle and indicates methods for gaining employee co-operation.

results.title: Every man for himself
results.creator_credit: Arthur Bedford, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Hiding from the Germans amongst olive trees in Greece, Arthur Bedford and his fellow soldiers were told to get out. “Every man for himself”. Not only did they manage to escape, they managed to fend off a enemy bombing attack and didn’t suffer a single casualty.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Bedford, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Best life
results.creator_credit: Keifer Yu, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Keifer Yu takes us beyond the tourist attractions of Broome, Western Australia, to the cultures therein. Yu focuses on the Indigenous and Chinese cultures of which he is a part. He considers how the differing cultures have enriched his life and how they blend in together in this unique community.

results.title: An interview with Cyril Sayles
results.brief_description: At the age of 16, Cyril Sayles, not wanting to continue his manual labour in the mines, decided to join the army. Having lied about his age, he had a special made uniform and was off to fight the Germans in World War II. Cyril humorously shares his story of strength and courage, through his battle and imprisonment during the war.
results.description: At the age of 16, Cyril Sayles, not wanting to continue his manual labour in the mines, decided to join the army. Cyril humorously shares his story of strength and courage, through his battle and imprisonment during the war.

results.title: Internal organization
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Illustrates the fundamental purposes of business organization and basic organizational procedures, such as delegation of authority, division of labour and assignment of responsibility. Shows the types of organization that can be adapted to the needs of any enterprise.

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [Warnambool veterans]
results.brief_description: Fourteen veterans tell their stories, from the Australian Army, the Royal Australian Navy, and the Royal Australian Air Force. They share their memories from World War II, the Korean and Vietnam Wars and from the Australian home front. Ten stories from and four interviews with Victorian veterans based in Port Fairy and Warnambool.
results.title_for_label: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [Warnambool veterans]

They share their memories from World War II, the Korean and Vietnam Wars and from the Australian home front. Ten stories from and four interviews with Victorian veterans based in Port Fairy and Warnambool.

Ten stories from and four interviews with Victorian veterans based in Port Fairy and Warnambool.

results.title: Spuds again
results.brief_description: Irrespresible and cheeky, Avis Quarrell was an avid church goer but liked nothing more than making fun of her superiors. One particular day landed her in hot water and back to peeling spuds.

results.title: A Secret war room
results.creator_credit: Joan Peck, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Joan Peck served in the WAAAF as a radio telephone operator at Number one fighter sector in Preston. Their main role was to connect the army, navy and airforce in one central control to help protect and defend the Victorian coastline. Peck used state of the art technology at work, yet didn’t even have a telephone at home. Her highly secretive and crucial work at the centre was often interspersed with a spot of knitting.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joan Peck, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My brother's birthday
results.creator_credit: Max Hammond, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In Syria, on the way to Beirut, Max Hammond’s thoughts turned to his family. One of seven children, Hammond and his three brothers served together in World War II. He recounts a close call that occurred on his brother’s birthday and reflects on how lucky he and his brothers are.

results.title: John Miles: drafted Vietnam
results.brief_description: John Miles recalls the 29th of September 1965 as the date that he commenced his National Service. While he was away, the political climate changed dramatically in Australia. Miles remembers his experience of the Vietnam War and his struggles once home in Australia. Miles’ treatment on return to Australia initially made left him feeling bitter, but a trip back to Vietnam was crucial to his personal transformation and healing.
results.description: John Miles recalls the 29th of September 1965 as the date that he commenced his National Service. While he was away, the political climate changed dramatically in Australia. Miles remembers his experience of the Vietnam War and his struggles once home in Australia. Miles’ treatment on return to Australia initially made left him feeling bitter, but a trip back to Vietnam was crucial to his personal transformation and healing.

Miles’ treatment on return to Australia initially made left him feeling bitter, but a trip back to Vietnam was crucial to his personal transformation and healing.
